document.title: Doctrinal Elements of a Curriculum Framework for the Development of Catechetical Materials for Young People of High School Age

399D69F58CC7484286A573B3DA9E8085.description:
The Catholic Church is committed to seek unity in
faith, and she works toward that, but such work for
unity cannot compromise the truth of the faith.

D0E9B5D61B3B4481B351D6CEBEAF7452.description:
Other breaks from the Catholic Church were
the result of impatience on the part of those who
saw a need for reform or a problem they wished
to address.

F3CB8FF2EE2A405998C1FAA88ED64FEC.description:
Generally, other churches broke away from the
Catholic Church because of some human element
such as a disagreement with how beliefs are
expressed or explained, or a desire to change forms
of worship, or political or personal reasons. While
the Church has the fullness of truth, not
all her members appropriate and live that fullness
of truth.

7A8DA0A0D6634A4B8A04CCB6065E9629.description:
If the Catholic Church truly has the fullness of truth,
why have other churches broken away from her?

A726A2851D05411AB32E38869D265457.description:
The historical context in which these events
happened: the people of those days dealt differently
with threats and problems than we might do so
now. They used means that were commonly used
in their society then. We cannot judge them as
harshly as some people judge them today.

D3AE1270919149D080CF8F15427D516C.description:
Pope John Paul II, on various occasions, apologized
for the sins of the members of the Church in her
history, including for harm caused by the excesses
of the Inquisition and atrocities committed during
the Crusades.

48647DB4A22A4368B3AC3238B0F80E6C.description:
Many members of the Church are also holy and
possess a heroic sanctity witnessed to by the
countless sacrifices many have made, often to the
point of martyrdom.

F523C1032885433C8678ADF2886C6C7F.description:
Despite the sins of her members, including the
ordained, the Church is entrusted by God with
the truth of the Gospel and the graced means
of salvation.

EB1705A50E2742E6ABE61A78CF1868F1.description:
Though the members of the Church are prone to
sin, the Church herself is sinless and holy.

19A1C6302F31430BB87AA14BFD29283A.description:
The Church is a source and means of holiness for
people because God has made it so. The failures
of the Church’s members during her history are
lamentable. The virtuous lives of the saints validate
the truth and power of the Church’s sacraments
and teaching.

5AB972C43E344B7B8E55A1E559103425.description:
How can the Church claim to be holy and a protector
of truth when there are things in her history like the
Crusades, the Inquisition, the persecution of Jews, and
the Galileo case?

EDD238B17F8A442BB5BFBC9FEC1CFDF8.description:
American saints: Elizabeth Seton, Frances
Cabrini, John Neumann, Katharine Drexel,
Rose Philippine Duchesne, Theodora
Guerin; Blessed Junipero Serra, Blessed Kateri
Tekakwitha.

226A9C3E29EF4F769678C88C111F23E8.description:
Rise of youth and young adult activities in the
Church: World Youth Days.

4926B7DBFB0C4FF49094810C7E6DCF41.description:
Multiple forms of lay leadership—less
polarization.

2B9761D28B6F4D99952EBEBFBA330C3B.description:
Influence of the Catechism of the Catholic
Church.

EC0867725F864BFD8597829769695BE4.description:
Regrowth of seminaries and new religious
communities.

834123609AA64B4183EF3AE8BE017FE1.description:
Pro-life movement—adult stem cell research
and benefits.

C14CB53813F14D44A5E5F2B3B92EB27E.description:
Impact of the papacy of Pope John Paul II—
leadership, evangelization.

EE1C87611B2B450484921FBAD2D32BC2.description:
Rapid secularization of society and breakdown
of the family.

F5E6C1969FF44AABBC2091EA697FEFC2.description:
Church attendance and vocations to

870A148B59454799846296A6FC233844.description:

blurred.

112D35F448C1499B8278E206833A6393.description: Late twentieth to start of twenty-first century.

5973586E4AE641189A755FA6C303E4C9.description:

10A5E51B3BD04D63A4E0150516623A61.description:

05A047E30AA446E0B7AA2ACE34B7A86F.description:

of the world’s Catholic colleges and universities are

516CFDCB7AAA42AFAF286FCA1E050544.description:
Rise of parochial schools and education of children

0F825045F8C84C3EBA0BCA437087D3B7.description:

4356A53ACECB4DCFAA862FD64CD5104F.description:

721B283C59E840DC9A6267231AF96216.description: Addresses clash of culture and civilization with faith.

FCDC04E361E94A1EB52E67113AE23B5D.description:
Assassination attempt: example of courage, faith,
and forgiveness.

608A6CB3766A40EDAC80CA40ED213788.description:

new evangelization.

59FED019014B4C6681B48F9542CECEF7.description:

6FB0E1C4B3F64C69A25A499CA112A88F.description:

EA90EF6DB3B34C67A9A9D00CC042A377.description: Fides et Ratio, Evangelium Vitae, Veritatis Splendor.

4E68BBB311A84458A6B04C474BEA900E.description:

12E28E1942C54C43AC7E010DAD8ADD83.description:

1844D0DACA374AF0B090C5D8C859984B.description:

Fathers and doctors of Church include
St. Basil, St. Gregory Nazienzen, St. John
Chrysostom, St. Athanasius, St. Ephrem,
St. Ambrose, St. Jerome, St. Augustine, St.
Leo the Great, St. Gregory the Great. (N.B.
Lives of saints should be mentioned throughout
this course both to show the restoration of faith
and hope in times of crisis as well as to illustrate
ways of encountering Christ through all periods of
Church history.)

3424735CD7E2432F9D669B78F585BD38.description:
Preaching was a powerful means for catechesis

With sermons and commentaries on Scripture

Empire was tolerant in principle but changed
